title: What is the meaning behind "Può il piú venire dal meno?" and its connection to the denigration of Roman civilization?
first_phrase: This text is a continuation of the previous discussion on the question of whether the greatest can come from the least. It references several sources, including T. Ragon's "Orthoduxie Afac-onnique" and Stanislas de Guaita's "Au scuil du Mystère", which have presented opposing views on the topic. The current section features a quote from Marco Saunier, author of a popular book in the occultist field, who argues that Rome was founded by Etruscan initiates but later fell into the hands of brutes who imposed their strength on the world. Saunier also attributes the remedy for the city's backwardness to Christianity.

last_phrase: In conclusion, despite the systematic denigration of Roman culture throughout history, Christianity was able to find a balance between strength and intelligence through the power of sentimental love. This led to the establishment of a society of goodwill and kindness, where the atrocities of the past have been eradicated, and people strive to build a better world for all.
